HAI Burden Data (Germany and EU/EEA)

hai_burden.Rd

A dataset summarising the estimated burden of healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) in Germany and the EU/EEA, based on Zacher et al. (2019).

Usage

hai_burden

Format

A data frame with 90 rows and 6 variables:

measure

Type of burden measure (e.g. "HAIs per 100k", "Deaths per 100k", "DALYs per 100k")

sample

Sampling group: "German_PPS", "German_convenience", or "EU_EEA"

infection

Type of infection (HAP, UTI, BSI, SSI, CDI, or All)

estimate

Estimated value per 100,000 population

ci_low

Lower bound of uncertainty interval (simulated)

ci_high

Upper bound of uncertainty interval (simulated)

Source

Zacher B. et al. (2019). EuroSurveillance, 24(46): 1900135.

Examples

data("hai_burden")
head(hai_burden)
#> # A tibble: 6 √ó 6
#>   measure       sample     infection estimate ci_low ci_high
#>   <chr>         <chr>      <chr>        <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 HAIs per 100k German_PPS HAP          132    116.    146. 
#> 2 HAIs per 100k German_PPS UTI          265.   246.    284. 
#> 3 HAIs per 100k German_PPS BSI           33.4   29.8    35.5
#> 4 HAIs per 100k German_PPS SSI          115.   108.    130. 
#> 5 HAIs per 100k German_PPS CDI           44.6   42.1    50.8
#> 6 HAIs per 100k German_PPS All          592.   506.    644.
